namePart.#text: b. ?Kashan, ca. 1570/978 AH - d. ?Isfahan, 1635/1045 AH, Iranian

note: Citation/references: Masterpieces of Islamic Art: The Decorated Page from the 8th to the 17th Century, ; Eric Schroeder, "Two Persian Paintings", Bulletin of the Fogg Art Museum, Fogg Art Museum (Cambridge, MA, March 1950), vol. XI, no. 2, pp.72-73, plate 3 ; Anthony Welch, Shah 'Abbas & The Arts of Isfahan, exh. cat., Asia Society (New York, NY, 1973), page 26/figure 8 ; Marianna Shreve Simpson, Arab and Persian Painting in the Fogg Art Museum, Fogg Art Museum (Cambridge, MA, 1980), page 86-87/figure 31 ; Dr. Sheila R. Canby, The Rebellious Reformer: The Drawings and Paintings of Riza-yi Abbasi of Isfahan, Azimuth Editions Ltd. (London, England, 1996), Page 58 & 182/Figure 24 ; David Roxburgh, The Persian Album, 1400 - 1600: from Dispersal to Collection, Yale University Press (U.S.) (New Haven, 2005), p 325/ fig 174

Exhibitions: Precisely to the Point, Daggers and Drawings from Persia and India: 15th-19th century, Harvard University Art Museums, Cambridge, 05/30/1992 - 07/26/1992 ; Linear Graces ... and Disgraces: Part I, Drawings from the Courts of Persia, Turkey, and India, 15th-19th Centuries, Harvard University Art Museums, Cambridge, 10/15/1994 - 12/11/1994 ; Arab and Persian Painting, Fogg Art Museum, Cambridge, 02/10/1981 - 03/09/1981 ; Diverse are their Hues: Animals in Islamic Art, Harvard University Art Museums, Fogg Art Museum, Cambridge, 12/18/1984 - 02/09/1985 ; The Tablet and the Pen: Drawings from the Islamic World, Harvard University Art Museums, Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Cambridge, 02/18/2006 - 07/23/2006
Provenance: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Francis H. Burr Memorial Fund, 1948.59
